content.description:
The first pitch is a route named "Le coin", Coeur de Dragon being the second pitch.

Amazing clean aid line, with a couple of micro nuts, and one or two hook moves. Good protection overall. Two roofs and, a subtle overhanging face, and a nice final traverse makes a very airy ambiance and a very nice route.

With aid, the free climbing level is 5.7. Full free climbing, it is 5.13a.

The starts is on the obvious corner full left of the Parapluie cliff. You can see two bolts juste before the roof, that is the second aid (or hard free) pitch.
Pros, bolted belays

“It is composed of two very hard cruxes, one in the beginning of the first half and one long crux in the middle of the second half of the route that finishes with a hard dead-point on a sloper.” 
 -Nicolas Gaudreault

unknown

Start on the detached block. Easy moves lead to a tricky dihedral. 



The left most sport climb in Le Parapluie

12 bolts

Classic!!! One of the long 5.13's of the Parapluie. A crux at the beginning to get in and out of the small dihedral (stick-clip recommended). The beginning is done from the ground and not from the big boulder. The route continues with several extremely varied boulders separated by gigantic rests. The first one on the arete, another one to pass the small roof and a last spectacular crux on the last overhang, which is really worth it. Despite the quality of the rock which leaves something to be desired at the beginning, this route is really worth it. A must-do if you climb the grade.

Classique!!! Une des longues 5.13 du parapluie. Un crux au début pour entrer et sortir du petit dièdre (stick-clip recommandé). Le début se fait bien du sol et non du gros bloc. La voie se poursuit avec plusieurs blocs extrêmement variés séparés de repos gigantesques. Un premier sur une arête, un autre pour passer le petit toit et un dernier pas spectaculaire sur le dernier dévers, qui vaut vraiment la peine. Malgré la qualité de la roche qui laisse à désirer au début, cette voie vaut vraiment la peine. Un must-do si on grimpe la cote.



The very distinct ridge that marks the left of the wall. Start on the ground at the foot of the big blocks.

L'arête très distincte qui marque la gauche du mur. Commencer au sol au pied des gros blocs.


About ten bolts + the anchor

Une dizaine de bolt + l'ancrage

First crux is near the ground and was kind of cryptic for me, especially regarding the foot holds. Continue straight up toward the roof. Clipping at the roof is easy but getting out of it is the second crux. Nice face climbing on crimps after the roof, easier if you go slightly toward left at the end to use a flake/finger crack.



On the right side of the main wall, near the arête.

sport, anchor without rap rings at the top
A very classic cliff. The level tends to be moderate to hard, but you can find a couple of easy routes. 5.6 to 5.13d.
